page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Employment prospects within the area of the block are limited. Where these do exist the numbers thus employed are small due to the high degree of mechanisation both in agriculture and light industry.The two major employers are engaged in a)the dried food industry based within Heckington,and b)road maintenance and resurfacing which entails working within a radius of approximately 100 miles of the village.Other industries tend to be small scale family units providing a service of some kind e.g.jobbing builders,painters,decorators and electricians.A small proportion of the population is engaged in casual agricultural work of a seasonal nature.The remainder who are employed tend to be in the services(R.A.F.)or travel to the centres of population Sleaford,Boston,Grantham or Lincoln.
